reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Scaling up quality and appropriate GBV Response and Prevention services to populations who might not otherwise have access to those services

description.narrative:
This project seeks to scale up quality and appropriate GBV protection, response and prevention services to populations who might not otherwise have access to these services. UNFPA, as the lead of the GBV sub sector and technically the provider of last resort, has conducted an analysis of the overall GBV response environment. As a result, these activities are tailored to take measures to address and cover the gaps both associated with the actual response, field coordination as well as enhancing capacity of partners to scale up and improve the quality of response in line with the principles of Do NO HARM. They are designed taking into consideration the developments and complexities within the context, for instance the anticipated gains made by the military that will result into liberation of persons being held captive or still under the control of non-state actors as well as the ongoing refugee returns.
The key areas of focus for the project will be on establishing GBV mobile response capacity, support to reception, screening and reintegration where the unique needs of women, girls and children are identified and addressed capacity building for GBV partners and GBV incident management, documentation and reporting. The project will be guided by the following objectives
1. Enhance capacity of frontline GBV response workers to provide quality and targeted response to persons at risk of violence 2. Strengthen community relevant approaches that respond to immediate and intermediary needs for returnee women and girls (returning from captivity or refugee returnees) 3. Restore dignity of women and girls through establishing safety measures targeting women and girls by providing GBV risk mitigation services 4. Improve mechanisms for gender based violence incident management, reporting and documentation
Project location: While the capacity building components on the project will focus on improving the quality of GBV programming and response for the three states, the actual response components will target 3 locations in Borno – Kala Balge, Mobbar and Dikwa, 1 location in Yobe – Gujba and 1 in Adamawa – Michika.

receiver-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs
